content.text:
I'll start by exploring the codebase to understand its structure and then focus on the test drive form as specified in the instructions.

<parameter name="pattern">**/*</parameter>
<parameter name="path">C:\Users\georg\dealerflow</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
The user just said "Warmup" which seems like they want me to get familiar with the codebase. Let me explore the structure first.
</thinking>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Bash">
<parameter name="command">find /c/Users/georg/dealerflow -type f -name "*.js" | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
Let me explore the codebase structure to understand what we're working with.
</thinking>

<function_calls>

<parameter name="command">ls -la /c/Users/georg/dealerflow/</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
Let me get an overview of the project structure.
</thinking>

<function_calls>

</invoke>
</function_calls>

</thinking>

Let me see the pages structure.
</thinking>

<function_calls>

</function_calls>
<thinking>
This is a Next.js application for a dealer management system (DealerFlow). Let me look at the form templates since the user's instructions are about modifying the test drive form.
</thinking>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">C:\Users\georg\dealerflow\libs\formTemplates.js</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
Now I have a clear picture of the codebase. This is a Next.js dealership management application called DealerFlow. The key file for the test drive form is `libs/formTemplates.js` which contains the form field definitions.

Let me provide a summary of what I've learned during this warmup:
</thinking>

I've explored the DealerFlow codebase. Here's what I found:

## Project Overview

**DealerFlow** is a Next.js dealership management application with:

- **Framework**: Next.js 14.2.23 with React 18
- **Database**: MongoDB with Mongoose ODM
- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js with Google and Email providers
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with DaisyUI components
- **Key Features**: Vehicle management, forms, appraisals, sales prep, calendar, contacts, reviews, aftercare

## Key Structure

- **`/pages`** - Next.js pages and API routes
- **`/models`** - Mongoose schemas (Vehicle, Form, FormSubmission, Dealer, User, etc.)
- **`/libs`** - Utilities including `formTemplates.js` (form definitions), `authOptions.js`, `mongoose.js`
- **`/components`** - React components (DashboardLayout, ShareFormModal, etc.)

## Test Drive Form (from CLAUDE.md instructions)

The test drive form is defined in `C:\Users\georg\dealerflow\libs\formTemplates.js`. The current structure has:

- **Vehicle Information**: VRM lookup, Make, Model
- **Driver Details**: Name, Address, Phone, Email, DoB, License fields
- **Insurance Details**: Provider, Policy Number, Expiry, Cover Type
- **Test Drive Details**: Date, Time Out/In, Mileage, Fuel Level, Staff fields
- **Signatures**: Customer signature with date, Staff signature
- **Return Details**: Mileage In, Fuel Level In, Damage Description, Damage Photos

The instructions specify removing many fields and simplifying this form significantly.

### Critical Files for Implementation
- `C:\Users\georg\dealerflow\libs\formTemplates.js` - Contains the test drive form field definitions that need modification
- `C:\Users\georg\dealerflow\models\Form.js` - Form model schema
- `C:\Users\georg\dealerflow\models\FormField.js` - FormField model schema
- `C:\Users\georg\dealerflow\pages\forms\[formId].js` - Form display/submission page
- `C:\Users\georg\dealerflow\pages\public\[formId].js` - Public form view
